'''Archaeocryptography''' (from [[Ancient Greek|Greek]] {{lang|grc|ἀρχαῖος}}, ''arkhaios'', "ancient" and {{lang|grc|[[wikt:en:κρυπτός|κρυπτός]]}} (''kruptós''), "hidden, secret"; and {{lang|grc|[[wikt:en:γράφω#Ancient Greek|γράφειν]]}} (''graphein''), "to write") is the [[Research|study]] of decoding a monument or structure by determining the underlying mathematical order beneath the proportions, size, and placement to find any re-occurring or unusual data in respect to that which is being studied,<ref name=Munck>{{cite web|last=Munck|first=Carl|title=The Spirit of Ma'at|url=http://www.spiritofmaat.com/archive/nov2/munck.htm|publisher=Spirit of Maat|access-date=2 November 2012}}</ref> or within another monument or structure.
Archaeocryptography is not a recognized branch of [[archaeology]] or of any other academic discipline. It is an example of [[pseudoscience]] or [[pseudoarchaeology]] that employs contrived calculations involving many free parameters to achieve an impressive-looking result.<ref name=Schmeh>{{citation|last=Schmeh|first=Klaus| title = The Pathology of Cryptology—A Current Survey | journal =Cryptologia|volume= 36 | year=2012|publisher=Taylor and Francis Group|location=London|pages=14–45|doi = 10.1080/01611194.2011.632803 | quote = Arguments against archeocryptography are…: There are many numbers involved, which can be arranged in many different formulas and matched against many different values. Munck’s claims, therefore, would only be valid with a statistical foundation that proves that his findings are more than merely coincidence. However, Munck has never provided a proof like this. | postscript = , at pp. 19–20. }}</ref>
== Description == The word ''archaeocryptography'' is derived from ''archaeology'', which is the study of [[human]] activity in the past, and ''[[cryptography]]'', which is the study of techniques for secure communication in the presence of third parties.
== Methods == [[File:Biholomorphism illustration.svg|thumb|Mathematical coordinates including π may be used to form Grid Point Values]]Archaeocryptologists try to find underlying correlations in respect that which is being studied or decoded.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lauralee.com/munck.htm |title=Archaeocryptography, Carl Munck |author=Laura Lee |publisher=}}</ref> Some factors taken into consideration while deciphering an object, structure or [[megalith]]ic monument can include the features such as faces, stairs, sides, and terraces. The [[geolocation]] or mathematical operations are performed on latitude and longitude coordinates<ref name="Munck" /> as well as astronomical alignments, such as are found with [[archaeoastronomy]]. The incorporation of grids,<ref name=Wilcock>{{cite book|last=Wilcock|first=David|title=Chapter 11: Global Grid 2|year=2011|publisher=Penguin Group|location=New York|url=http://divinecosmos.com/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=67&Itemid=36}}</ref> the use of numerical ordering, mathematical constants, Biblical [[gematria]], and any other re-occurring number that might stand out from the decoding process are determining factors.
Archaeocryptologists then can use different mathematical formulas to find correlations within that which is being studied or between other monuments or structures that share any underlying factors. Popular examples are the [[Orion correlation theory]] <ref name="Bruce">{{cite book|last=Bruce|first=Alexandra|title=Science or Superstition (The Definitive Guide to the Doomsday Phenomenon)|year=2009|publisher=The Disinformation Company|isbn=978-1-934708-28-6|pages=46}}</ref> between the [[Giza pyramid complex]] and the [[Orion's Belt|three middle stars]] of the [[Orion (constellation)|constellation Orion]], and also theories<ref name=Richard>{{cite book | title = The Monuments of Mars: A City on the Edge of Forever | last = Hoagland | first = Richard C. | publisher = Berkeley | year = 1987 | isbn = 978-0-9381-907-83 | url = https://books.google.com/books?id=xBBMGwAACAAJ }}</ref> about the region of [[Cydonia (region of Mars)|Cydonia]] on [[Mars]].
== History == The coining of the word ''archaeocryptography'' is often attributed to Carl P. Munck,<ref name="Schmeh" /><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.greatdreams.com/gem10.htm |title=Geomorphic Resonance, by Michael Lawrence Morton}}</ref> who after retiring from the United States military in the late 1970s began studying [[Cartography|cartographic]] material, among other topics, trying to search for better answers as to why certain megalithic monument exist. This led him to a formula he believes architects used to place and design various megalithic monuments.<ref name=Lee>{{cite web|last=Lee |first=L |title=Archaeocryptography According to Carl Munck |url=http://www.atlantisrising.com/backissues/issue9/ar9archeocrypto.html |work=Magazine, Issue 9 |publisher=Atlantis Rising |access-date=1 November 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120220123118/http://www.atlantisrising.com/backissues/issue9/ar9archeocrypto.html |archivedate=20 February 2012 }}</ref> Munck's theory claims that calculations using selected numbers or dimensions found in megalithic monuments or [[Egyptian pyramids]] yield the [[latitude]] or [[longitude]] of the site.<ref name=Schmeh/> However, in Munck's findings, the [[prime meridian]] does not run through [[Greenwich]], but through the [[Great Pyramid of Giza|Great Pyramid]] in [[Giza]]. His theory is known simply as "The Code" and asserts that an ancient Jewish numerological system known as [[gematria]] is used in the manipulation of numbers to other key locations, mathematical components and positions of sights in the geometry of their construction.
The theory later become popularized and among other practitioners and researchers in pseudo-scientific fields, such as Michael Lawrence Morton, [[Richard C. Hoagland]], [[Bruce Cathie]], and Hugh Harleston Jr. They adapted archaeocryptography to their own studies, developing different theories <ref name="bruce"> {{cite book | title = 2012: Science Or Superstition (The Definitive Guide to the Doomsday Phenomenon) | author = Alexandra Bruce | publisher = The Disinformation Company | year = 2009 | isbn = 978-1-934708-28-6 | page = 46 | url = https://books.google.com/books?id=TtUKPVYK8qEC&pg=PA46 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://matrix-messenger.tripod.com/skymat_1.htm |title= Corroborating Weaver's Theory Of an Alnitak Prime Meridian, by Michael Lawrence Morton}}</ref> and books <ref name="Richard" /><ref name=Hugh>{{cite book | title = Mysteries of the Mexican Pyramids | last = Harleston Jr. | first = Hugh | publisher = Harper & Row | year = 1976 | isbn = 978-0060143244 | url = https://www.amazon.com/Mysteries-Mexican-Pyramids-Peter-Tompkins/dp/006014324X }}</ref><ref name=Carl>{{cite book | title = The Code | last = Munck | first = Carl P. | publisher = Radio Bookstore Press | year = 1976 | isbn = 978-1889071176 | url = https://books.google.com/books?id=iBYjAAAACAAJ }}</ref> based on the topic.
== In literary studies == The marginal, or even fictional, status of archaeocryptography was suggested in [[Zachary Mason]]'s novel ''[[The Lost Books of the Odyssey]]'', which purports to be a collection of lost works which the author describes as being as old as the [[Odyssey]] and which he claims to have decoded from a manuscript he had uncovered. In the author's biography at the conclusion of the book he describes himself as "the John Shade Professor of Archaeocryptography and Paleomathematics at [[Magdalen College, Oxford]]". The "lost books" were actually written by Mason and, as reviewers have noted, Mason is a novelist and computer scientist who lives in California, [[John Shade]] is a fictional poet in [[Vladimir Nabokov]]'s ''[[Pale Fire]]'', and no such professorship exists.<ref>{{Citation | last = Taoka | first = Yasuko | year = 2012 | title = A Liar's Yarn: Storytelling in ''The Lost Books of the Odyssey'' | journal = New Voices in Classical Reception Studies | issue = 7 | pages = 40–48 | url = http://www2.open.ac.uk/ClassicalStudies/GreekPlays/newvoices/Issue7/Yasuko-Taoka.pdf | access-date = 8 January 2016 }}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=A Calculus of Writing, Applied to a Classic|first=Larry|last=Rohter|date=February 9, 2010|access-date=9 January 2016|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2010/02/10/books/10mason.html|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]}}</ref>

The '''Arts and Humanities Data Service''' ('''AHDS''') was a [[United Kingdom]] national service aiding the discovery, creation and preservation of digital resources in and for research, teaching and learning in the [[arts]] and [[humanities]]. It was established in 1996 and ceased operation in 2008 (although the website and related digital collections are still accessible).
Organised via a Managing Executive at [[King's College London]] and five AHDS Centres, hosted by various UK Higher Education Institutions, the AHDS was funded until the end of March 2008 by the [[Joint Information Systems Committee]] and the [[Arts and Humanities Research Council]] (AHRC).
However, in March 2007 the AHRC decided to cease funding for the AHDS beyond March 2008. As a result, the AHDS is now advising AHRC applicants to ensure their projects include a budget for the costs of preservation and sustainability (whether with the AHDS or another service).
Following the demise of AHDS, and the cessation of the [[Methods Network]], the [[Centre for e-Research (CeRch)]] was established at [[King's College London]] in 2008. The Centre's aims are to facilitate interdisciplinary, institutional, national and international collaboration.
The five subject-based AHDS Centres are:
*[[AHDS Archaeology]] — [[University of York]] *[[AHDS History]] — [[University of Essex]] *[[AHDS Literature, Languages and Linguistics]] — [[Oxford University]] *[[AHDS Performing Arts]] — [[Humanities Advanced Technology and Information Institute|HATII]] at the [[University of Glasgow]] *[[AHDS Visual Arts]] — [[University for the Creative Arts]] (Farnham campus)
Specific areas of work that the Arts and Humanities Data Service covers include:
*[[digital preservation]] — including a series of [http://ahds.ac.uk/preservation/ahds-preservation-documents.htm preservation handbooks] detailing specific preservation issues with various digital file formats and information on its [http://ahds.ac.uk/preservation/repository.htm digital repository] *Advice on [[digitization]] — including a series of [http://ahds.ac.uk/creating/case-studies/ case studies] of existing digitization projects, [http://ahds.ac.uk/creating/information-papers/ information papers] on specific issues in digitization, and longer [http://ahds.ac.uk/creating/guides Guides to Good Practice] dealing with digitization topics in particular arts and humanities disciplines *Online collections created by universities and museums in the UK. These include: **[http://ahds.ac.uk/catalogue/ An online catalogue] with details of collections held within the archive **[http://www.ahds.rhul.ac.uk/ahdscollections/ Designing Shakespeare] — 40 years of [[William Shakespeare|Shakespearian]] performance in [[London]] and [[Stratford-upon-Avon|Stratford]] **[http://stormont-papers.ahds.ac.uk/ The Stormont Papers] - Parliamentary debates from Northern Ireland from 1921 to 1972.

This is the bibliography of American [[fantasy]] and [[science fiction]] writer [[Brandon Sanderson]].
==The Cosmere== Sanderson writes many of his works in an overarching universe known as the ''[[Cosmere]]'' with series tending to be on different planets within that universe. The works, especially the magic systems within them, are often subtly connected, and some characters appear across the various series.<ref>{{cite web|title=Let's talk about Brandon Sanderson's Cosmere|url=http://www.tor.com/2015/07/21/lets-talk-about-brandon-sandersons-cosmere/|website=Tor.com|accessdate=1 December 2015}}</ref>
===''Aether of Night'' series=== Announced with very few details. "Seeds" of the story are in multiple other ''Cosmere'' books.<ref name="2016 SotS"/>
===''Dragonsteel'' series=== This story (the story of the shattering of Adonalsium, as told by Hoid) is next-to-last in Sanderson's sequence of Cosmere novels (though it is first chronologically). It will probably be released once ''Stormlight'' volume 10 is done.<ref name="2016 SotS"/>
===''Elantris'' series=== * ''[[Elantris]]'' (2005, {{ISBN|0-765-31177-1}}) * Untitled sequels (forthcoming)<ref name="dec 2014 newsletter"/><ref name="state of the sanderson 2015">{{cite web|url=http://brandonsanderson.com/state-of-the-sanderson-2015/|title=State of the Sanderson 2015|first=Brandon|last=Sanderson|accessdate=January 26, 2016}}</ref>
====''Elantris'' short works==== * ''The Hope of Elantris'' (2006, no ISBN) (short story)<ref name="hope of elantris post">{{cite web|url=http://brandonsanderson.com/elantris-the-hope-of-elantris/|title=Brandon Sanderson: The Hope of Elantris|publisher=BrandonSanderson.com|accessdate=July 16, 2014}}</ref> * ''[[The Emperor's Soul]]'' (2012, {{ISBN|978-1-61696-092-6}}) (novella)<ref name="emperors soul post">{{cite web|url=http://brandonsanderson.com/book/The-Emperors-Soul|title=Brandon Sanderson: The Emperors Soul|publisher=BrandonSanderson.com|accessdate=July 29, 2013}}</ref>
===''First of the Sun'' series=== No novels have been announced in this series. * ''Sixth of the Dusk'' in ''[[Shadows Beneath]]'', edited by Peter Ahlstrom (novella) (2014, Dragonsteel Entertainment, {{ISBN|978-1-938570-03-2}})<ref name="intro writing excuses anthology">{{cite web|url=http://brandonsanderson.com/introducing-the-writing-excuses-anthology/|title=Introducing the Writing Excuses Anthology!|date=June 30, 2014|publisher=Dragonsteel Entertainment|accessdate=December 19, 2014}}</ref>
===''Mistborn'' series=== {{main|Mistborn series}} In addition to the original trilogy and the ''Wax and Wayne'' series, there are at least two other trilogies planned in the ''Mistborn'' series.<ref name="dec 2014 newsletter"/><ref name="state of the sanderson 2015"/>
====Original trilogy==== * ''[[Mistborn: The Final Empire]]'' (2006, {{ISBN|0-765-31178-X}}) * ''[[Mistborn: The Well of Ascension]]'' (2007, {{ISBN|0-765-31688-9}}) * ''[[Mistborn: The Hero of Ages]]'' (2008, {{ISBN|978-0-765-31689-9}})
====''Wax and Wayne'' series==== Also called "Era Two" of the ''Mistborn'' series.<ref name="2016 SotS"/> ''Alloy of Law'' was originally a standalone work, but became part of a tetralogy.<ref name="dec 2014 newsletter"/><ref name="state of the sanderson 2015"/> * ''[[Mistborn: The Alloy of Law]]'' (2011, {{ISBN|978-0-765-33042-0}}) * ''[[Mistborn: Shadows of Self]]'' (2015, {{ISBN|978-0-765-37855-2}})<ref name="dec 2014 newsletter"/><ref name="amazonuk mistborn shadows of self">{{cite web|url=https://www.amazon.co.uk/Mistborn-Shadows-Self-Brandon-Sanderson/dp/1473208211/|title=Mistborn: Shadows of Self|publisher=Amazon.com|accessdate=December 19, 2014}}</ref> * ''[[Mistborn: The Bands of Mourning]]'' (2016, {{ISBN|978-0-765-37857-6}})<ref name="dec 2014 newsletter"/><ref name="tor alloy sequels">{{cite web|url=http://www.tor.com/blogs/2013/10/tor-acquires-two-more-mistborn-novels-from-brandon-sanderson|title=Tor Acquires Two More Mistborn Novels from Brandon Sanderson|publisher=Tor|accessdate=2013-10-29}}</ref> * ''Mistborn: The Lost Metal'' (working title, forthcoming, tentatively scheduled for Fall 2019)<ref>https://brandonsanderson.com/state-of-the-sanderson-2017/</ref>
====''Mistborn'' novella==== *''[[Mistborn: Secret History]]'' (2016), a companion story to the original Mistborn trilogy.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://brandonsanderson.com/books/mistborn/secret-history/|title=Secret History|publisher=}}</ref>
===''Silverlight'' series=== There is a planned novella, but no details have yet been released.<ref name="2016 SotS"/>
===''The Stormlight Archive''=== {{main|The Stormlight Archive}} Ten books are planned in this series in two five-book cycles.
* ''[[The Way of Kings]]'' (2010, {{ISBN|978-0-765-32635-5}})<ref name="QandA-Oct-2012"/><ref name="sanderson784">{{cite web|url=http://www.brandonsanderson.com/blog/784/Another-Long-Winded-Explanation-of-Various-Things|title=''Another Long-Winded Explanation of Various Things''|publisher=BrandonSanderson.com|accessdate=May 9, 2009}}</ref><ref name="sanderson blog done">{{cite web |url=http://www.brandonsanderson.com/blog/803/DONE|title=Brandon Sanderson Blog: DONE|date=July 7, 2009}}</ref> * ''[[Words of Radiance]]'' (2014, {{ISBN|978-0-765-32636-2}}) <ref name="tor words of radiance tour schedule">{{cite web|url=http://www.tor.com/blogs/2014/01/words-of-radiance-tour-schedule|title=Announcing the Words of Radiance Brandon Sanderson Book Tour|publisher=Tor.com|date=January 29, 2014|accessdate=December 19, 2014}}</ref> * ''[[Oathbringer]]'' (2017, {{ISBN|978-0-765-32637-9}})<ref name="first draft complete outhbringer">{{cite web|title=Brandon Sanderson Has Completed the First Draft of Oathbringer, Book 3 of The Stormlight Archive|url=http://www.tor.com/2016/12/09/first-draft-oathbringer-stormlight-archive/|publisher=Tor.com|accessdate=12 December 2016}}</ref> * Untitled fourth book (forthcoming, 2020)<ref name="2016 SotS">{{cite web|url=http://brandonsanderson.com/state-of-the-sanderson-2016/|title=State of the Sanderson 2016|first=Brandon|last=Sanderson|date=December 19, 2016|accessdate=December 19, 2016|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6msfAdL5Q?url=http://brandonsanderson.com/state-of-the-sanderson-2016/|archivedate=December 19, 2016|deadurl=yes|df=}}</ref>
====''Stormlight'' novellas==== * ''Edgedancer'' (2016, included within ''[[Arcanum Unbounded: The Cosmere Collection]]'') <ref name="Tor-ArcanumUnbounded">{{cite web|url=http://www.tor.com/2016/06/21/revealing-brandon-sandersons-arcanum-unbounded-coming-november-2016/|title=Announcing Brandon Sanderson’s Arcanum Unbounded, Coming November 2016|publisher=Tor|accessdate=30 June 2016}}</ref> * ''Wandersail'' (planned)<ref>https://brandonsanderson.com/state-of-the-sanderson-2017/</ref>
===''Threnody'' series=== At least one novel is planned, though no specific details have been announced.<ref name="2016 SotS"/>
====''Threnody'' novella==== * ''Shadows for Silence in the Forests of Hell'' in [[Dangerous Women (anthology)|''Dangerous Women'']], edited by [[George R.R. Martin]] and [[Gardner Dozois]] (novella) (2013, Tor Books, {{ISBN|978-0-765-33206-6}})
===''Warbreaker'' series=== * ''[[Warbreaker]]'' (2009, {{ISBN|978-0-765-32030-8}}) * ''Nightblood'' (forthcoming)<ref name="dec 2014 newsletter"/>
===''White Sand'' graphic novel series=== ''White Sand'' is set on Taldain where there are Daysiders and Darksiders who harness arcane powers to manipulate sand. The writer is Rik Hoskin and the artist is Julius Gopez with colors by Ross Campbell.<ref name="white sands">{{cite web|url=http://www.newsarama.com/29004-brandon-sanderson-s-fantasy-epic-comes-to-comic-books-with-white-sand-preview.html|title=BRANDON SANDERSON's Fantasy Epic Comes To Comic Books With WHITE SAND Preview|date=April 26, 2016|accessdate=June 2, 2014|publisher=Newsarama}}</ref> The works are based on an original manuscript by Sanderson.<ref name="white sands - may 2014">{{cite web|url=http://brandonsanderson.com/hugo-voter-packet-with-the-wheel-of-time-convention-deadlines-white-sand-graphic-novels/|title=Hugo Voter Packet with The Wheel of Time, Convention Deadlines, White Sand Graphic Novels|date=May 30, 2014|first=Brandon|last=Sanderson|accessdate=December 19, 2014|publisher=Dragonsteel Entertainment}}</ref> * ''[[White Sand (graphic novel)|White Sand]]'' #1 (with Rik Hoskin and Julius Gopez) (June 22, 2016, {{ISBN|978-1-60690-885-3}}, [[Dynamite Entertainment]])<ref name="state of the sanderson 2015"/> * ''White Sand'' #2 (February 20, 2018, {{ISBN|978-1-52410-342-2}}, [[Dynamite Entertainment]]) * ''White Sand'' #3 (forthcoming untitled graphic novel, date TBA, Dynamite)
===Cosmere standalone novella=== * ''Silence Divine'' (working title, forthcoming), set in the Shardworld Ashyn, in the Greater Rosharan solar system (novella)<ref name="dec 2014 newsletter"/>
===Cosmere short work collections=== * ''[[Arcanum Unbounded: The Cosmere Collection]]'', (November 2016)
==Other works==
===''Alcatraz'' series=== * ''[[Alcatraz Versus the Evil Librarians]]'' (2007, {{ISBN|978-0-439-92550-1}}) * ''[[Alcatraz Versus the Scrivener's Bones]]'' (2008, {{ISBN|978-0-439-92553-2}}) * ''[[Alcatraz Versus the Knights of Crystallia]]'' (2009, {{ISBN|978-0-439-92555-6}}) * ''[[Alcatraz Versus the Shattered Lens]]'' (2010, {{ISBN|978-0-439-92557-0}}) * ''Alcatraz Versus the Dark Talent'' (2016, {{ISBN|978-0-7653-8140-8}}) * ''Bastille vs. the Evil Librarians: The Worldspire'' (forthcoming)<ref name="2016 SotS"/>
===''Adamant'' series=== This is an "epic science fiction space opera" series released every other month as serial novellas. Sanderson plans to write four of the six and have co-authors for the other two. No release dates have been announced.<ref name="2016 SotS"/>
===''Dark One'' series=== A series about a boy who learns he is destined to destroy the world. The series was announced in December 2014, but no information on number of volumes or release dates were included.<ref name="dec 2014 newsletter">{{cite web|url=http://brandonsanderson.com/state-of-the-sanderson-december-2014/|title=State of the Sanderson: December 2014|date=December 18, 2014|accessdate=December 18, 2014|first=Brandon|last=Sanderson|publisher=Dragonsteel Entertainment}}</ref> The Dark One series was originally set in the Cosmere but it got 'pulled out'.<ref>https://brandonsanderson.com/state-of-the-sanderson-2017/</ref> In 2018 it was announced that Sanderson partnered with FremantleMedia and Random House Studio to produce Dark One as a television series, along with a series of novels, a prequel podcast and graphic novel that will be published by Vault Comics.<ref>https://deadline.com/2018/06/brandon-sanderson-fremantlemedia-north-america-tv-multi-media-project-1202407862/</ref>

[[Duplass Brothers Productions]] }} | distributor = [[The Orchard (company)|The Orchard]] | released = {{Film date|2014|3|8|[[South by Southwest|SXSW]]|2015|6|23|United States}} | runtime = 77 minutes | country = United States | language = English | budget = | gross = }} '''''Creep''''' is a 2014 American [[Independent film|independent]] [[Found footage (film technique)|found footage]] [[horror film]] directed by [[Patrick Brice]], based on a story written by Brice and [[Mark Duplass]], and is Brice's [[directorial debut]], as well. Creep premiered on March 8, 2014, at [[South by Southwest]], and was released on [[video on demand]] on June 23, 2015, by [[The Orchard (company)|The Orchard]] prior to an international release via [[Netflix]] on July 14, 2015.{{cite web|title=Netflix Finds ‘Creep’ Footage For July Premiere|url=http://bloody-disgusting.com/news/3344787/netflix-finds-creep-footage-july-premiere/|publisher=Bloody Disgusting|accessdate=June 7, 2015}} The film follows Aaron (portrayed by Brice), a videographer who answers an ad, created by Josef (portrayed by Duplass). As they get closer together, he discovers that his client is not who he was expecting.{{cite web|last=Gayne|first=Zach|title=SXSW 2014 Interview: Talking to CREEP's Mark Duplass And Patrick Brice|url=http://twitchfilm.com/2014/03/sxsw-2014-interview-talking-to-creeps-mark-duplass-and-patrick-brice.html|work=[[Twitch Film]]|accessdate=March 18, 2014}} ==Plot== Aaron ([[Patrick Brice]]) is a [[videographer]] who decides to work for Josef ([[Mark Duplass]]) after answering his ad. All Aaron has to do is record Josef throughout the day. Aaron drives up to a secluded home up a steep driveway. After making him wait for quite a while, upon arrival, Josef insists on hugging Aaron, and insinuates there will be "more of that to come." Josef explains that the home is his family vacation home, and that he beat cancer two years earlier but now has a large brain tumor. His wife, Angela, is pregnant, and Aaron will be recording a series of videos for Josef's unborn son, as he is dying and will never be able to see him grow up. Josef tells Aaron that he and his wife are calling the baby "Buddy." Josef's first request for Aaron is to record him taking a bath with Buddy. He simulates holding a baby, then pretends to drown to scare Aaron. Later, Josef asks Aaron to go hiking with him. While getting a jacket, Aaron is startled by a wolf mask in the closet; Josef tells him that his father used to wear the mask, pretending to be a friendly wolf named Peachfuzz. While hiking, Josef claims to know of a secret place with "healing waters" and leads Aaron to a hidden waterfall. He writes "J+A" on a large stone with a rock, drawing a heart around the initials. Throughout their time together, Josef repeatedly scares Aaron, excusing his behavior by claiming he has a "weird sense of humor." At a restaurant after their hiking trip, Aaron becomes suspicious that Josef has never been to this restaurant, or even the area. Josef asks Aaron if he has ever been ashamed of anything. Aaron tells him that as a child, he would often pee himself to a point where he wore a monitor to alert him when it became wet. Josef then admits to Aaron that while Aaron was waiting for Josef's arrival, he took photos of him standing by the front door. Josef says it was only because he wanted to get to know Aaron before meeting him and apologizes profusely. As Aaron gets ready to leave that night, Josef asks him to stay for a drink. Aaron is already suspicious of Josef's behavior and insist on leaving, but reluctantly agrees to join him. Josef asks Aaron to turn off the camera, claiming that what he was going to say was not appropriate for Buddy. Aaron shuts off the video but leaves the sound on. Josef tells him he lied about Peachfuzz, and he wore the wolf mask in order to rape his wife to confirm his suspicions about her [[animal pornography]] habit. An unsettled Aaron then attempts to leave, but is unable to find his keys. Josef tells Aaron that he should wait to leave till the morning, that it will be easier to find the keys and to sleep off the alcohol. Aaron agrees. He then drugs Josef's whiskey with Benadryl, and lays him to sleep. Josef begins to talk in his sleep, saying very disturbing things to Aaron and even begins to touch himself. Aaron attempts to search Josef for his keys when Josef's phone begins to ring. Aaron answers the phone to Josef's "wife," who tells Aaron that she is really his sister, and that her brother has problems. She insist that he leaves the house, with or without his keys. The call drops, and Aaron returns to find Josef gone. Aaron searches the home until Josef scares him again and tells him that he doesn't want to die. Aaron tells Josef that he spoke to his sister, and that he wants to help Josef. Josef becomes angry and runs back into the home. Aaron attempts to leave, but finds Josef blocking the front door with the Peachfuzz mask on. Aaron asks Josef to please let him leave, in which Josef shakes his head 'no' and begins to growl and grope the door. Aaron charges at him, and the camera shuts off. When the video resumes, Aaron reveals that he escaped and made it home, but soon received a DVD in the mail from Josef. It depicts Josef dragging filled trash bags up a hill, and burying them. Aaron thinks it is meant as a threat but does not call the police. Aaron admits that he has been having terrible nightmares about Josef wearing a wolf mask and Aaron wearing a baby mask, dancing in the waterfall they previously visited. Aaron then receives a large box with a knife and a stuffed wolf in it, as well as another DVD with a video of Josef apologizing and saying that he really cares about Aaron. Josef now repeatedly calls Aaron "Buddy" in the videos. Per Josef's instructions, Aaron rips open the stuffed wolf to find a locket with Josef's and Aaron's pictures in it. Upset, Aaron throws everything away. Aaron decides to go to the police, which are no help due to the fact that he does not know anything about Josef, including his full name. That night, Aaron hears odd noises in his home which prompts him to investigate. As Aaron searches his home, Josef can be seen looking through the front door. Josef runs away as Aaron approaches. Aaron does not see Josef, and goes to the alleyway only to find his trash knocked over. Later that night as Aaron sleeps, Josef turns on the camera and films Aaron, even cutting off a piece of Aaron's hair. Aaron wakes up to find that the screen in his window ripped, and another DVD labeled "My Last Video" next to his bed. Josef, in the video, apologizes again, revealing that he found the locket in Aaron's trash, which hurt him greatly. He claims this led to the realization that he needs help, as he is sad and needs a friend. He asks Aaron to come to a public lake by his house to talk so they could finally have "closure." His pleas move Aaron enough to compel him to go to the lake. Aaron leaves the camera rolling from his car and has 911 on speed dial just in case. Upon arrival Aaron does not find Josef, and sits on a bench overlooking the lake to wait for him. Josef is seen approaching Aaron from behind and stands there for a few moments, before putting on the Peachfuzz mask. He then sneaks closer to Aaron and reveals an axe in his hand. Still unbeknownst to Aaron, Josef stands behind Aaron with the axe over him, before he swings it into Aaron's skull, killing him instantly. Josef is then shown filming himself watching the murder tape, which he has already done several times before. He expresses admiration and even puzzlement at Aaron's naivety and kindness, and claims he loves him and considers him to be his favorite "of them all." He puts a DVD labeled "Aaron <3" in a cabinet full of videos and DVDs with different people's names on them, as he identifies himself as Bill over the phone while speaking to yet another person about hiring them to film him. ==Cast== * [[Mark Duplass]] as Josef * [[Patrick Brice]] as Aaron * [[Katie Aselton]] as Angela (voice) ==Production== Duplass said that the film's story "was inspired by character-driven dramas that are, at their heart, two-handers: ''[[My Dinner with Andre]]'', ''[[Misery (film)|Misery]]'', and ''[[Fatal Attraction]]''" as well as "[his] myriad of strange [[Craigslist]] experiences over the years."{{cite web|last=Whittaker|first=Richard|title=Mark Duplass Is a Creep|url=http://www.austinchronicle.com/daily/screens/2015-07-14/mark-duplass-is-a-creep/|publisher=''[[The Austin Chronicle]]''|date=July 14, 2015|accessdate=October 23, 2016}} Brice and Duplass originally began working on ''Creep'' under the working title ''Peachfuzz'', but chose to rename the film as the title's relevance came later in the movie's plot and they did not want viewers to "spend the first half hour trying to figure out why the movie is called Peachfuzz and [not] pay attention to the very intricate details".{{cite web|last=Turek|first=Ryan|title=SXSW Interview: Mark Duplass, Patrick Brice on Bringing Creep to Life|url=http://www.shocktillyoudrop.com/news/349719-sxsw-interview-mark-duplass-patrick-brice-on-bringing-creep-to-life/|publisher=STYD|accessdate=March 18, 2014}} The two built the movie from a series of conversations they had with one another and decided to refine ''Creep'' while they were filming, which enabled them to film and screen portions of the film to see what would or wouldn't work on camera. As a result, the film had multiple alternate end scenarios and Duplass stated that there were "10 to 12 permutations of each scene". Of the creative process for his character, Josef, Duplass explained "We were interested in the psychological profile of this very, very strange person. We were very interested in how you meet people and don’t quite understand what’s up, but you start to get signs. For us that was intense eye contact, lack of personal space, oversharing, maybe a little bit too much love here and there. But, for me, there’s something wrong with both of these guys. Deeply. This concept of, 'who is the creep in this scenario?'"{{cite web|title=Mark Duplass And Patrick Brice On Mixing Comedy And Terror In 'Creep'!|url=http://bloody-disgusting.com/news/3282601/sxsw-14-interview-mark-duplass-and-patrick-brice-on-mixing-comedy-and-terror-in-creep/|publisher=Bloody Disgusting|accessdate=March 18, 2014}} [[File:Herzogshut Liechtenstein 1756.jpg|thumb|Ducal hat and insignia of the princely Liechtenstein [[primogeniture]] (gouache from 1756, Liechtenstein Museum)]] The '''Ducal hat of Liechtenstein''' (German: ''Herzogshut'') is a former crown of the [[Prince of Liechtenstein|Princes of Liechtenstein]], who were also [[Duchy of Troppau|Dukes of Troppau and Jägerndorf]]. It went missing in the 18th century.
== History == The ducal hat of Liechtenstein was commissioned in 1623 by Prince [[Karl I, Prince of Liechtenstein|Karl I of Liechtenstein]] and completed in 1626. It was discovered to be missing in 1781,<ref name="book">Liechtenstein: The Princely Collections {{ISBN|0-87099-385-2}} Metropolitan Museum of Art, Middle Village, New York, U.S.A., 1985.</ref> following the death of Prince [[Franz Joseph I, Prince of Liechtenstein|Franz Joseph I]], and it remains lost to the [[House of Liechtenstein]] since that time.
In 1976, the people of Liechtenstein presented a replica of the crown to Prince [[Franz Joseph II, Prince of Liechtenstein|Franz Josef II]] on his 70th birthday.<ref name="book" /> The replica is based on the only drawing of the crown, dated 1756, and is [http://www.tourismus.li/en/our-country/Liechtenstein-highlights/Highlights-Liechtenstein/Princely-Crown-National-Museum on display in the Liechtenstein National Museum].
The circlet of the crown was modeled on the circlet of the [[Imperial Crown of Austria]], while eight jeweled acanthus leaves, alternately large and small, rested on the rim of the circlet. As with the imperial crown of [[Rudolf II, Holy Roman Emperor|Rudolf II]], the precious stones used in this crown were white (diamonds and pearls) and red (rubies or red spinels), which may have had some alchemist significance. Inside the crown was a red velvet cap topped with a large jeweled button.
The gems used on the crown were chosen in accordance with the alchemical principles subscribed to in the Rudolphine Court, with the crown apparently being designed to protect its possessor against evil.<ref name="book" /><ref name="gembook">Gemmarum et lapidum historia (Hanau, 1609)</ref>
According to Emperor Rudolph's physician, [[Anselmus de Boodt]] (1550–1632), diamonds have an inherent power that wards off evil spirits, rubies protect against illness and poison and will warn the wearer when danger threatens by turning dark, and pearls strengthen the health of the wearer and counter the effects of poison.<ref name="book" /><ref name="qbook">Quellenband, {{ISBN|3-205-06271-X}} (EAN: 9783205062714 / 978-3205062714, Böhlau 1983</ref>
The only depiction of the original crown dates from 1756, a [[gouache]] painting that is kept in the [[Liechtenstein Museum]].
== References == <!--- See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Footnotes on how to create references using <ref></ref> tags which will then appear here automatically --> {{Reflist}}
== Literature == * Wilhelm, Gustav: ''[http://www.eliechtensteinensia.li/JBHV/1960/60/Der_historische_liechtensteinische_Herzogshut.html Der historische liechtensteinische Herzogshut]''. in: Jahrbuch des Historischen Vereins für das Fürstentum Liechtenstein, 1960, Volume. pp, S. 5-20. (in German)

'''Earthscore''' is a notational system that enables collaborating videographers to produce a shared perception of environmental realities.<ref>http://www.globalpossibilities.org/old/project1c_062599_5.html</ref><ref name="google">{{cite book|title=The Three Person Solution: Creating Sustainable Collaborative Relationships|author=Ryan, P.|date=2009|publisher=Purdue University Press|isbn=9781557535047|url=https://books.google.co.uk/books?id=EQk8oG7wFPUC|accessdate=2015-06-19}}</ref> The system optimizes the use of video and television in the context of [[Environmental movement|the environmental movement]] by incorporating the [[cybernetics|cybernetic]] ideas of [[Gregory Bateson]] and the [[semiotics]] of [[Charles Sanders Peirce]]. The intent of the system is to generate human behaviors that comply with the self-correcting mechanisms of the Earth.<ref>http://www.earthscore.org/articles/intro_earthscore_overview.pdf</ref> Earthscore has been studied and utilized by university students and academics worldwide since 1992.<ref name="earthscore">{{cite web|url=http://www.earthscore.org/New%20Format/background/resume.html|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20061002102103/http://www.earthscore.org/New%20Format/background/resume.html |archive-date=2006-10-02 |dead-url=yes|title=Paul Ryan's Resumé|accessdate=2015-06-19}}</ref><ref name="annealockwood">{{cite web|url=http://www.annealockwood.com/compositions/bowfalls.htm|title=Annea Lockwood » Bow Falls (2003)|publisher=annealockwood.com|accessdate=2015-06-19}}</ref><ref name="luisberriosnegron">{{cite web|url=http://www.luisberriosnegron.org/10-10-4AXPc3@SPFi/LBN_AXPc3_10-10.html|title=The Anxious Prop, Case 3|publisher=luisberriosnegron.org|accessdate=2015-06-19}}</ref><ref name="reocities">{{cite web|url=http://www.reocities.com/Athens/5260/ssaprog.html|title=Athens/5260/ssaprog|publisher=reocities.com|accessdate=2015-06-19}}</ref>
Earthscore was developed and created by [[The New School]] professor and artist [[Paul Ryan (video artist)|Paul Ryan]], and originally published by [[NASA]] in 1990.<ref name="si">{{cite web|url=http://www.aaa.si.edu/collections/searchimages/images/item_9938.htm|title=Art and survival: the Earthscore Notational System for sharing perception of the natural world, from the Paul Ryan papers - Image Gallery | Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution|author=Archives of American Art|publisher=aaa.si.edu|accessdate=2015-06-19}}</ref><ref name="newschool">{{cite web|url=http://www.newschool.edu/mediastudies/faculty-subpage.aspx?id=4294967751|title=404 Error | The New School in New York City|publisher=newschool.edu|accessdate=2015-06-19}}</ref><ref name="eai">{{cite web|url=http://www.eai.org/artistBio.htm?id=400|title=Electronic Arts Intermix : Paul Ryan : Biography|publisher=eai.org|accessdate=2015-06-19}}</ref><ref name="edge">{{cite web|url=http://www.edge.org/3rd_culture/bios/ryan.html|title=Edge: PAUL RYAN|publisher=edge.org|accessdate=2015-06-19}}</ref>
==Components== In its most complete and succinct iteration, Earthscore is a notational system with five components. These components are:<ref name="earthscore2">{{cite web|url=http://www.earthscore.org/article%20pages/earthscore_eco/earthscore_notational_system.html|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20061002102424/http://www.earthscore.org/article%20pages/earthscore_eco/earthscore_notational_system.html |archive-date=2006-10-02 |dead-url=yes|title=The Earthscore Notational System|accessdate=2015-06-19}}</ref> * '''Three Comprehensive Categories of Knowledge''': The categories of firstness, secondness, and thirdness * '''The Relational Circuit''': A circuit that organizes the categories of firstness, secondness, and thirdness in unambiguous, relative positions * '''Threeing''': A formal, teachable version of cooperation * '''The Firstness of Thirdness''': A spontaneous, intuitive appreciation of a pattern in nature * '''The [[semiotics|Semiotic]] System for Interpretation''': A process of generating signs to approach knowledge
===Three Comprehensive Categories of Knowledge=== [[Image:Universal Categories.jpg|right|thumb|The Three Peircean Categories]] Using the [[trikonic]] categories of firstness, secondness, and thirdness developed by American philosopher [[Charles Sanders Peirce]], Earthscore splits knowledge into three modes of being: firstness (positive quality), secondness (actual fact), and thirdness (laws that will govern facts in the future), and defines these categories as "a theory of everything".<ref name="google2">{{cite book|title=The Three Person Solution: Creating Sustainable Collaborative Relationships|author=Ryan, P.|date=2009|publisher=Purdue University Press|isbn=9781557535047|url=https://books.google.co.uk/books?id=EQk8oG7wFPUC|page=60|accessdate=2015-06-19}}</ref><ref name="earthscore3">{{cite web|url=http://www.earthscore.org/New%20Format/article%20pages/earthscore_eco/earthscore_notational_system.html|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20061002102039/http://www.earthscore.org/New%20Format/article%20pages/earthscore_eco/earthscore_notational_system.html |archive-date=2006-10-02 |dead-url=yes|title=The Earthscore Notational System|accessdate=2015-06-19}}</ref>
Firstness is positive quality in the realm of spontaneity, freshness, possibility, and freedom. Earthscore defines firstness as being "as is", without regard for any other. Examples include: the taste of banana, warmth, redness, and feeling gloomy.<ref name="experimentaltvcenter">{{cite web|url=http://www.experimentaltvcenter.org/history/people/pview.php3?id=42|title=People | The History Project|publisher=experimentaltvcenter.org|accessdate=2015-06-19}}</ref>
Secondness is a two-sided consciousness of effort and resistance engendered by being up against brute facts. Earthscore defines secondness as the "facticity", or "thisness", of something, as it exists, here and now, without rhyme or reason. Examples include: pushing against an unlocked door and meeting silent, unseen resistance.<ref name="stichting-mai">{{cite web|url=http://www.stichting-mai.de/hwg/amb/aai/art_as_inquiry_13.htm|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20040716215839/http://www.stichting-mai.de/hwg/amb/aai/art_as_inquiry_13.htm|archive-date=2004-07-16|dead-url=yes|title=M.J.Bijvoet - Art As Inquiry|author=Marga Bijvoet|accessdate=2015-06-19|df=}}</ref>
Thirdness mediates between secondness and firstness, between fact and possibility. ''Earthscore'' defines thirdness as the realm of habit and laws that will govern facts in the future, and posits that a knowledge of thirdness can allow predictions of how certain future events will turn out. It is an 'if...then' sort of knowledge. Thirdness consists in the reality that future facts of secondness will conform to general laws.<ref name="earthscore3"/>
===The Relational Circuit===
The relational circuit is a self-penetrating, tubular continuum with six unambiguous positions which attempts to supply a [[Continuum (topology)|topological continuum]] to the [[trikonic]] categories. The circuit organizes differences in terms of firstness, secondness, and thirdness, and three "in-between" positions that connect them within the continuum. The relational circuit is to the Earthscore System what the staff and bars are to classical music notation, and is the basis of the third component, threeing.<ref>http://muse.jhu.edu/login?uri=/journals/leonardo/v039/39.3ryan.pdf</ref><ref>http://www.earthscore.org/articles/ed_creating_curriculum_two.pdf</ref><ref name="electricity-tool">{{cite web|url=http://www.electricity-tool.com/doc/216963-Component-Two:-The-Relational-Circuit/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110710181115/http://www.electricity-tool.com/doc/216963-Component-Two%3A-The-Relational-Circuit/|archive-date=2011-07-10|dead-url=yes|title=Component Two: The Relational Circuit-Electricity Tool | electricity tool|accessdate=2015-06-19|df=}}</ref>
===Threeing===
Threeing is a practice in which three people take turns playing three different roles; initiator, respondent and mediator, in an attempt to solve relational confusion. The roles correspond to the categories of firstness, secondness, and thirdness. Through role playing, the three individuals interact with each other spontaneously and recursively, following the relational circuit.<ref name="earthscore4">{{cite web|url=http://www.earthscore.org/New%20Format/Curriculae/threeing_curriculum.html|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20061002102108/http://www.earthscore.org/New%20Format/Curriculae/threeing_curriculum.html |archive-date=2006-10-02 |dead-url=yes|title=Threeing Relationships|accessdate=2015-06-19}}</ref>
Threeing is further broken down into ten different subsections:<ref name="earthscore5">{{cite web|url=http://www.earthscore.org/New%20Format/article%20pages/threeing/threeing_lesson_intro.html|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20061002102709/http://www.earthscore.org/New%20Format/article%20pages/threeing/threeing_lesson_intro.html |archive-date=2006-10-02 |dead-url=yes|title=Introduction to Lessons in Verbal Threeing|accessdate=2015-06-19}}</ref>
* Profiling Skills and the Talking Stick * Diagnosing Relational Problems * Dividing the Tasks * Making Decisions * Reading Charles Peirce * Imitating Sherlock Holmes * Cultivating Creativity * Solving Problems * Planning to Three * Exploring the Yoga of Threeing
===The Firstness of Thirdness===
Earthscore utilizes the Firstness of Thirdness as a means of creativity, in an attempt to imagine an ecologically sustainable life before living it. By incorporating pure firstness as the realm of spontaneity, Earthscore uses the disciplines of [[Zen]], [[yoga]], and [[T'ai chi ch'uan|T'ai chi]] to cultivate the human capacity to be comfortable in pure firstness and yield new insights and visions.
===The Semiotic System for Interpretation===
Earthscore approaches knowledge as a process of generating signs, and incorporates the semiotic system of Charles Sanders Peirce consistent with the trikonic categories: A sign (firstness) representing an object (secondness) for an interpretant (thirdness). Earthscore exfoliates the threefold division into a sixty-six-fold classification of signs that is inclusive of everything in nature, in order to systematize both interdisciplinary and multimedia representations of ecosystems.
==See also== {{col-begin}} {{col-break}} * [[Communication studies]] * [[Cultural studies]] * [[Critical theory]] * [[Cybernetics]] * [[Encodings]] * [[Information theory]] * [[International Association for Semiotic Studies]] {{col-break}} * [[Linguistics]] * [[Logic]] * [[Meaning (semiotics)|Meaning]] * [[Media studies]] * [[Semiotic elements and classes of signs (Peirce)]] * [[Semiotic information theory]] * [[Semiotic Society of America]] {{col-end}}
==References== ;Bibliography {{refbegin}} * Ryan, Paul (2009). ''The Three Person Solution''. [https://books.google.com/books?id=EQk8oG7wFPUC Eprint]. * Shook, John. (2005). "Bateson, Gregory", ''Dictionary American Philosophers''. * Strate/Wachtel. (2005). "McLuhan and Earthscore", ''The Legacy of McLuhan''. * Ryan, Paul (2005). "Bateson, Peirce and the Three-Person Solution", ''American Semiotic Society Journal''. * Clarke, D. S. (2003). ''Sign Levels''. Dordrecht: Kluwer. * [[Daniel Chandler|Chandler, Daniel]]. (2001/2007). ''Semiotics: The Basics''. London: Routledge. * Ryan, Paul (1997). ''Fire Water Father''. New York City: Earth Group. * Ryan, Paul (1993). ''Video Mind, Earth Mind''. New York City: Peter Lang Publishers. * Ryan, Paul (1991). "A Sign of itself", ''On Semiotic Modeling''. New York City: Eds. Anderson/Merrell * Clarke, D. S. (1987). ''Principles of Semiotic''. London: Routledge & Kegan Paul. * Ryan, Paul (1974). ''Cybernetics of the Sacred''. New York City: Doubleday Anchor. * Peirce, C.S. (1867), "On a New List of Categories", ''Proceedings of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences'' 7 (1868), 287‚Äì298. Presented, 14 May 1867. Reprinted (''Collected Papers'', vol. 1, paragraphs 545‚Äì559), (''The Essential Peirce'', vol. 1, pp. 1‚Äì10), (''Chronological Edition'', vol. 2, pp. 49‚Äì59), [http://www.cspeirce.com/menu/library/bycsp/newlist/nl-frame.htm Eprint]. * Peirce, C.S. (1885), "One, Two, Three: Fundamental Categories of Thought and of Nature", Manuscript 901; the ''Collected Papers'', vol. 1, paragraphs 369-372 and 376-378 parts; the ''Chronological Edition'', vol. 5, 242-247 {{refend}}
;Notes {{reflist}}
==External links== * {{official website|http://www.earthscore.org}}

<!--[[File:ΓΕΡΟΝΤΑΣ ΠΑΣΤΙΤΣΙΟΣ - ELDER PASTITSIOS Facebook page cover (small).jpg|thumb|"Elder Pastitsios" Facebook page cover]]-->{{Infobox website |name = ΓΕΡΟΝΤΑΣ ΠΑΣΤΙΤΣΙΟΣ - ELDER PASTITSIOS |logo = [[File:ΓΕΡΟΝΤΑΣ ΠΑΣΤΙΤΣΙΟΣ - ELDER PASTITSIOS Facebook page cover (small).jpg|300px]] |logocaption = The page cover featuring the [[flag of Greece]], [[Flying Spaghetti Monster]] as [[Madonna (art)|Madonna]] holding a baby [[dinosaur]], a [[Christian cross]] and "Elder Pastitsios" with [[pastitsio]] face. |screenshot = |collapsible = |collapsetext = |caption = |url = {{URL|www.facebook.com/gerontas.pastitsios}}<ref name=facebook /><ref name=police /> |commercial = No |type = [[Facebook page]] |registration = Optional |language = Greek |num_users = 18,658 subscribers (Jan 2014) |content_license = |owner = |author = |editor = |launch_date = <!--{{Start date and age|YYYY|MM|DD|df=yes/no}}--> |alexa = |revenue = |current_status = online |footnotes = }} '''Elder Pastitsios''' ({{lang-ell|Γέρων/Γέροντας Παστίτσιος}}, ''Géron/Gérontas Pastítsios'') is a [[Satire|satirical]] figure of a fictitious [[monk]] who first appeared in a [[Facebook page]]. The satire is mostly based on the famous [[Greeks|Greek]] [[Eastern Orthodox Church|Orthodox]] monk [[Elder Paisios of Mount Athos|Elder Paisios]], with his name and face substituted by [[pastitsio]] — a local [[pasta]] and [[béchamel sauce]] dish, thus combining Greek Orthodox and [[Pastafarian]] imagery.<ref name=facebook>{{cite web|url=http://www.facebook.com/gerontas.pastitsios/timeline?filter=2|title=ΓΕΡΟΝΤΑΣ ΠΑΣΤΙΤΣΙΟΣ - ELDER PASTITSIOS|last1=Loizos|first1=Philippos|publisher=Facebook|date=2012|language=Greek|accessdate=October 4, 2012}}</ref> The page ran for about a year until it was closed down after the arrest of its creator for [[blasphemy]] on [[Portal:Current events/2012 September 21|September 21, 2012]]. The case, which started as a Facebook [[Flaming (Internet)|flame]], reached the [[Hellenic Parliament|Greek Parliament]] twice and created a strong local as well as international [[political]] impact.
==Background== The main satire of the page revolved around [[Elder Paisios]] (d. 1994), a monk from [[Mount Athos|Holy Mountain]], famous for his spiritual teachings. Much has been written about his person and his prophecies concerning the [[End time]]s, the upbringing of children, couples' relationships, even the [[diet (nutrition)|diet]] Paisios supposedly followed. High-ranking priests as well as believers have proposed that the Elder should be [[glorification|recognised]] as a [[Saint]] by the [[Greek Orthodox church|Orthodox Church]].<ref name=csmonitor /> The page criticised, among others, the exploitation of Paisios by the press and by Orthodox [[website]]s that propagate the alleged [[prophecies]] and teachings of the [[charisma]]tic Elder (according to his followers he had predicted the [[fall of the Soviet Union]] and the recent [[Greek government-debt crisis|Greek crisis]]).<ref name=prin />
The "Elder Pastitsios" page satirised and criticised (with no reported profanity according to the media),<ref name=csmonitor /> various [[Orthodoxy in Greece|religious aspects in Greece]] such as [[infant baptism]], [[religious education]] in schools and the lack of separation between [[church and state]]; these were presented through the eyes of the [[Pastafarian]] [[Parody religion|satirical pseudo-religion]] "Church of the Flying Spaghetti Monster", which has been used to lampoon the teaching of [[creationism]] in schools.<ref name=csmonitor />
The page created a [[hoax]] about a posthumous [[miracle]] by Elder Paisios<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fimes.gr/2012/09/gerontas-pastitsios/|script-title=el:Το θαύμα που επινόησε ο Γέρων Παστίτσιος|publisher=fimes.gr|date=September 26, 2012|language=Greek|trans-title=The miracle that Elder Pastitsios invented|accessdate=September 30, 2012}}</ref> which was submitted to various Orthodox, conservative and far-right blogs in July. The story was based on several existing accounts that were already [[reblogging|circulating online]] and involved the miraculous recovery of a teenager who supposedly woke from a [[coma]] after his mother placed a [[talisman]] with dirt from Elder Paisios’ grave under his pillow.
The story reached 93,800 [[Google search]] results and was reproduced both online and in print, and even became a cover story on the far-right newspaper "Eleftheri Ora".<ref name=seleo /> The 27-year-old page creator would later state that he did this to expose the gullibility of the faithful, and also to show the poor fact-checking done among the religious and conservative [[blogosphere]].<ref name=vaxevanis />
Four days before the page creator's arrest, [[Member of Parliament|MP]] Christos Pappas from the far-right [[Golden Dawn (Greece)|Golden Dawn]] party had brought the page to the attention of the [[Minister of Justice (Greece)|Minister of Justice]] by raising a [[Question time|question]] to the Greek Parliament on September 17.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://newpost.gr/post/155764/%CE%95%CF%81%CF%8E%CF%84%CE%B7%CF%83%CE%B7-%CF%83%CF%84%CE%B7-%CE%92%CE%BF%CF%85%C3%8E-%CE%AE-%CE%B1%CF%80%CF%8C-%CF%84%CE%B7-%CE%A7%CF%81%CF%85%CF%83%CE%AE-%CE%91%CF%85%CE%B3%CE%AE-%CE%B3%CE%B9%CE%B1-%CF%84%CE%BF%CE%BD----%CE%93%CE%AD%CF%81%CE%BF%CE%BD%CF%84%CE%B1-%CE%A0%CE%B1%CF%83%CF%84%CE%AF%CF%84%CF%83%CE%B9%CE%BF/|script-title=el:Ερώτηση στη Βουλή από τη Χρυσή Αυγή για τον... Γέροντα Παστίτσιο|publisher=newpost.gr|date=September 22, 2012|language=Greek|trans-title=Question to the Parliament by Golden Dawn on... Elder Pastitsios|accessdate=September 30, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.newsnow.gr/article/217811/erotisi-sti-vouli-apo-ti-xrysi-avgi-gia-tin-aisxri-kai-prosvlitiki-selida-sto-facebook-gia-ton-geronta-pasio.html|title=Ερώτηση στη Βουλή από τη Χρυσή Αυγή για την αισχρή και προσβλητική σελίδα στο facebook για τον... Γέροντα Παΐσιο..|publisher=newsnow.gr|date=September 22, 2012|language=Greek|trans-title=Question to the Parliament by Golden Dawn on the obscene and offensive facebook page for... Elder Paisios ..|accessdate=September 30, 2012}}</ref> The police claimed they had already concluded their investigation two days before the question was raised in parliament due to thousands of complaints by Orthodox believers worldwide.<ref name=police>{{cite web|url=http://www.astynomia.gr/index.php?option=ozo_content&lang=%27..%27&perform=view&id=20338&Itemid=965&lang=|title=24-09-2012:H Δίωξη Ηλεκτρονικού Εγκλήματος συνέλαβε 27χρονο ημεδαπό για κακόβουλη βλασφημία και καθύβριση θρησκευμάτων, μέσω του Facebook|publisher=Greek Police|date=September 24, 2012|language=Greek|trans-title=Cyber Crimes Division arrested 27 year old local for malicious blasphemy and offense of religion, via Facebook|accessdate=October 2, 2012}}</ref>
==Arrest and reaction== On 21 September, the 27-year-old man was arrested in [[Greece]] on charges of malicious blasphemy and offense of [[religion]]<ref name=police /> for the creation of a satirical [[Facebook page]] called "Elder Pastitsios".<ref name=csmonitor /><ref name=prin>{{cite web|url=http://www.prin.gr/2012/09/pastichios.html|script-title=el:Γέρων Παστίτσιος: Σύλληψη κατ'εντολή της Χρυσής Αυγής|last1=Stavroula|first1=Katerina|publisher=Prin newspaper|date=September 30, 2012|language=Greek|trans-title=Elder Pastitsios: Arrest by order of Golden Dawn|accessdate=October 4, 2012}}</ref><ref name=cfi>{{cite web|url=http://www.centerforinquiry.net/blogs/entry/elder_pastitios_arrest_rekindles_debate_on_blasphemy_laws_in_greece/|title="Elder Pastitsios" Arrest Rekindles Debate on Blasphemy Laws in Greece|last1=Fidalgo|first1=Paul|publisher=Center For Inquiry|date=September 28, 2012|accessdate=September 30, 2012}}</ref><ref name=jakarta>{{cite web|url=http://www.thejakartaglobe.com/international/greek-police-smite-facebook-man-for-taunting-orthodox-monk/546329|title=Greek Police Smite Facebook Man for Taunting Orthodox Monk|publisher=The Jakarta Globe|date=September 24, 2012|accessdate=October 2, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/09/24/gerontas-pastitsios-pastafarian-facebook-greece-elder-paisios_n_1909511.html?ir=Religion|title='Gerontas Pastitsios' Pastafarian Facebook Page Leads To Blasphemy Arrest In Greece|last1=Jauregui|first1=Andres|date=September 24, 2012|accessdate=September 30, 2012|work=Huffington Post}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.heavy.com/news/2012/09/greece-arrests-pastafarian-blasphemy-monk-facebook/|title=Greece Arrests Pastafarian for Blasphemy after he Mocked a Monk on Facebook|last1=Prospect|first1=Neil|publisher=heavy.com|date=September 26, 2012|accessdate=September 30, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.zgeek.com/forum/index.php?threads/pastafarian-arrested-for-blasphemy.174964/|title=Pastafarian arrested for blasphemy|publisher=zgeek.com|date=September 26, 2012|accessdate=September 30, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://boingboing.net/2012/09/29/greek-pastafarian-arrested-for.html|title=Greek Pastafarian arrested for "Cyber Crimes"|last1=Doctorow|first1=Cory|publisher=boingboing.net|date=September 29, 2012|accessdate=September 30, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://greece.greekreporter.com/2012/09/24/golden-dawn-presses-arrest-for-blasphemy/|title=Golden Dawn Presses Arrest for Paisios Blasphemy|last1=Papapostolou|first1=A.|date=September 24, 2012|accessdate=September 30, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ibtimes.co.uk/articles/387369/20120924/elder-paisios-geron-pastitsios-greece-blasphemy-orthodox.htm|title=Greece: Golden Dawn 'Force' Arrest over Monk Elder Paisios Facebook Page Blasphemy|last1=Mezzofiore|first1=Gianluca|date=September 24, 2012|accessdate=September 30, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.keeptalkinggreece.com/2012/09/24/greek-police-arrests-man-27-for-blaspheming-a-monk-on-facebook/|title=Greek Police Arrests Man, 27, for Blaspheming a Monk on Facebook|date=September 24, 2012|accessdate=September 30, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://greekvoices.blogspot.gr/2012/09/blog-post_187.html|script-title=el:ΥΠΟΘΕΣΗ ΠΑΣΤΙΤΣΙΟΣ:Η "ΕΛΛΑΔΑ" ΓΙΝΕΤΑΙ ΙΡΑΝ ΜΕ ΤΙΣ ΕΥΛΟΓΙΕΣ ΤΗΣ ΧΡΥΣΗΣ ΑΥΓΗΣ!!|publisher=greekvoices|date=September 27, 2012|language=Greek|trans-title=The Pastitsios case: Greece becomes Iran with the eulogies of Golden Dawn|accessdate=September 30, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dailydot.com/news/greece-geron-pastitsios-elder-paisios/|title=Greek authorities charge man with blashemy for Facebook page|publisher=The Daily Dot|date=September 25, 2012|accessdate=October 4, 2012}}</ref><ref name=protothema /> Blasphemy in Greece carries a fine of up to 3,000 €, and up to 2 years imprisonment.
The news of the arrest created a worldwide interest in the case with the [[Twitter]] [[hashtag]] #FreeGeronPastitsios becoming a global trending topic and a relevant [[petition]] by the [[Humanism|Humanist]] Union of Greece has received over 10,000 signatures so far on [[Change.org]].<ref name=seleo>{{cite web|url=http://www.seleo.gr/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=70748:2012-09-26-08-02-56&catid=74:sites&Itemid=54|script-title=el:Πως ο Γέροντας Παστίτσιος κορόιδεψε με ένα θαύμα-μαϊμού την Χρυσή Αυγή|publisher=seleo.gr|date=September 26, 2012|language=Greek|trans-title=How Elder Pastitsios mocked Golden Dawn with a fake miracle|accessdate=September 30, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ekathimerini.com/4dcgi/_w_articles_wsite1_1_25/09/2012_462786|title=Greek police arrest man behind Facebook page satirizing 'mystical' priest|publisher=ekathimerini.gr|date=September 25, 2012|accessdate=September 30, 2012}}</ref>
In a [[web television]] interview<ref name=vaxevanis>{{cite video|title=ΑΥΤΟΣ ΕΙΝΑΙ Ο ΠΑΣΤΙΤΣΙΟΣ! (This is Pastitsios!)|publisher=Kostas Vaxevanis|location=Athens, Greece|date=September 27, 2012|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mLGalea0NnM|accessdate=September 30, 2012}}</ref> after his arrest, the page owner said that the evidence that led the e-crimes bureau of the Greek police to him were all provided by Facebook. Pan-Euro communications manager of Facebook, Iain Mackenzie wrote that Facebook disclosed basic subscriber information in response to a Greek [[court order]] without knowing what type of charges the user was subject to.<ref name=csmonitor>{{cite web|url=http://www.csmonitor.com/World/Europe/2012/1002/Blasphemy-in-democracy-s-birthplace-Greece-arrests-Facebook-user|title=Blasphemy in democracy's birthplace? Greece arrests Facebook user.|last1=Apostolou|first1=Nikolia|publisher=The Christian Science Monitor|date=October 2, 2012|accessdate=October 4, 2012}}</ref> According to article 19 of the [[Constitution of Greece|Greek Constitution]], limiting of confidentiality of communications is allowed only in cases of "particularly serious crimes." The Greek [[criminal code]] translates "particularly serious crimes" as [[Felony|felonies]] while "malicious blasphemy and offense of religion" is considered a [[misdemeanor]].<ref name=prin /><ref name=pandora>{{cite web|url=http://www.koutipandoras.gr/?p=26337|title=Το Facebook νίπτει τα χείρας του για τον "Παστίτσιο"|publisher=To Kouti Tis Pandoras|date=October 3, 2012|language=Greek|trans-title=Facebook washes its hands of "Pastitsios"|accessdate=October 4, 2012}}</ref>
Following the publication of the arrest, Greece's [[Coalition government|ruling coalition]] junior partner [[Democratic Left (Greece)|Democratic Left]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.iefimerida.gr/news/69211/%CE%B4%CE%B7%CE%BC%CE%B1%CF%81-%CE%BC%CE%B5-%CF%84%CE%B7-%CF%83%CF%8D%CE%BB%CE%BB%CE%B7%CF%88%CE%B7-%CF%84%CE%BF%CF%85-%C2%AB%CE%B3%CE%AD%CF%81%CE%BF%CE%BD%CF%84%CE%B1-%CF%80%CE%B1%CF%83%CF%84%CE%AF%CF%84%CF%83%CE%B9%CE%BF%CF%85%C2%BB-%CF%84%CE%BF-%CE%BA%CF%81%CE%AC%CF%84%CE%BF%CF%82-%CE%B1%CE%BA%CE%BF%CE%BB%CE%BF%CF%85%CE%B8%CE%B5%CE%AF-%CF%84%CE%B7-%CF%87%CF%81%CF%85%CF%83%CE%AE-%CE%B1%CF%85%CE%B3%CE%AE|script-title=el:ΔΗΜΑΡ: Με τη σύλληψη του "Παστίτσιου" το κράτος ακολουθεί τη Χρυσή Αυγή|publisher=iefimerida.gr|date=September 24, 2012|language=Greek|trans-title=Democratic Left: With the arrest of "Pastitsios" the State follows Golden Dawn|accessdate=September 30, 2012}}</ref> and the [[Greek Communist Party]] strongly denounced the arrest while leftist primary [[Opposition (politics)|opposition]] [[Political party|party]] [[SYRIZA]] raised a second question to the parliament, this time concerning the legality of the arrest and the freedom of expression.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.newsbomb.gr/politikh/story/237811/erotisi-syriza-sti-voyli-gia-ton-geronta-pastitsio|script-title=el:Ερώτηση ΣΥΡΙΖΑ στη Βουλή για τον "Γέροντα Παστίτσιο"|publisher=newsbomb.gr|date=September 26, 2012|language=Greek|trans-title=SYRIZA Questions Parliament on "Geron Pastitsios"|accessdate=September 30, 2012}}</ref> The parliamentary spokesman of SYRIZA and MP [[Dimitrios Papadimoulis]] stated that he would appear as a defense [[witness]] in the [[trial]] of the arrestee and even the [[metropolitan bishop]] of [[Thessaloniki]], Anthimos said on a radio show that he did "not agree with the [[prosecution]], better to leave him alone. No one can usurp the [[faith]]".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tanea.gr/ellada/article/?aid=4754456|script-title=el:Σε δίκη παραπέμφθηκε ο 27χρονος για τον "Γέροντα Παστίτσιο"|publisher=Ta Nea|date=September 25, 2012|language=Greek|trans-title=In court the 27 years old for "Elder Pastitsios"|accessdate=September 30, 2012}}</ref> Supporters of the arrestee held a small [[protest]] in front of the Greek Parliament on September 28<ref>{{cite video|title=Blogger supporters angry at blasphemy arrest in Greece|publisher=athensnewsweb|location=Athens, Greece|date=September 28, 2012|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RXSTsbUgg6c|accessdate=September 30, 2012}}</ref> and on the same night another one in the centre of [[Athens]] parodying an Orthodox [[litany]].<ref name=prin /><ref>{{cite video|title=Περιφορά Ιερού Σκηνώματος (τάβλα) Γέροντος Παστίτσιου στη χριστεπώνυμη συνοικία των Εξαρχείων (Procession of the Holy Relic (stiff) of Elder Pastitsios in the christian named Athenian neighborhood of Exarchia)|publisher=risinggalaxy|location=Athens, Greece|date=September 28, 2012|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m7UgWsWlHq4|accessdate=September 30, 2012}}</ref>
The page creator mentioned that he plans on focusing his future [[activism]] on the repeal of Greece's blasphemy laws.<ref name=vaxevanis />
==Conviction==
On January 16, 2014, the creator of the original "Elder Pastitsios" website was found guilty of "repeatedly insulting religion" and was [[Sentence (law)|sentenced]] to ten months in [[prison|jail]], [[Suspended sentence|suspended]]<ref name=Ethnos>{{cite web|url=http://www.ethnos.gr/article.asp?catid=22768&subid=2&pubid=63949339|script-title=el:Δέκα μήνες στον ...«Γέροντα Παστίτσιο» |publisher=Pegasus Network|date=January 17, 2014|language=Greek|trans-title=Ten months to... "the Elder Pastitsios"|accessdate=January 17, 2014}}</ref><ref name=TheGuardianJan2014>{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2014/jan/17/facebook-page-mocking-greek-orthodox-monk-jail-blasphemy# |title=Facebook page mocking Greek Orthodox monk leads to jail sentence |publisher=The Guardian |date=January 17, 2014 |accessdate=January 17, 2014}} </ref><ref name=tvxsJan2014>{{cite web |url=http://tvxs.gr/news/ellada/deka-mines-gia-ton-geronta-pastitsio |script-title=el:Δέκα μήνες για τον Γέροντα Παστίτσιο |language=Greek |trans-title=Ten months for Elder Pastitsios |last1=Michos |first1=Nikos |publisher=tvxs |date=January 16, 2014 |accessdate=January 17, 2014}} </ref> while the [[prosecutor]] had recommended a smaller sentence.<ref name=ethnosJan2014>{{cite web |url=http://www.ethnos.gr/article.asp?catid=22768&subid=2&pubid=63949339 |script-title=el:Καταδίκη του «Γέροντα Παστίτσιου» |language=Greek |trans-title=Conviction of "Elder Pastitsios" |last1= |first1= |publisher=Ethnos newspaper |date=January 16, 2014 |accessdate=January 17, 2014}} </ref> In the 2017 retrial, however, the court acquitted Loizos.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.efsyn.gr/arthro/apallahtike-o-gerontas-pastitsios|title=Απαλλάχτηκε ο "Γέροντας Παστίτσιος" (English: "Elder Pastitsios" is acquitted)|publisher=Efsyn.gr|accessdate=30 April 2018}}</ref>
==Internet meme== The idea of creating fictional characters based on Paisios quickly became a brief [[internet meme]] featured in mainstream media and even in [[T-shirt]]s, occasionally as a reaction to the arrest, and support to the page creator. Such characters include "Elder [[Paris]]ios" with monk's head substituted by the [[Eiffel Tower]],<ref name=protothema>{{cite web|url=http://www.protothema.gr/greece/article/?aid=225181|script-title=el:Συνελήφθη ο… Παστίτσιος, ήρθε και ο… Παρίσιος|publisher=Proto Thema newspaper|date=September 24, 2012|language=Greek|trans-title=Pastitsios arrested, here comes... Parisios|accessdate=October 4, 2012}}</ref> "Elder Papisios" from the Greek word for duck ({{lang-ell|παπί}}, ''papí'') and the face of [[Daffy Duck]],<ref name=axortagos>{{cite web|url=http://www.axortagos.gr/meta-geronta-pastitsio-erxetai-papisios.html|script-title=el:Μετά το γέροντα Παστίτσιο έρχεται ο… Παπίσιος|publisher=axortagos.gr|date=September 25, 2012|language=Greek|trans-title=After Elder Pastitsios here comes... Papisios|accessdate=October 4, 2012}}</ref> and many others.<ref name=msn>{{cite web|url=http://news.gr.msn.com/world/%CE%BC%CE%B5%CF%84%CE%AC-%CF%84%CE%BF%CE%BD-%CE%B3%CE%AD%CF%81%CE%BF%CE%BD%CF%84%CE%B1-%CF%80%CE%B1%CF%83%CF%84%CE%AF%CF%84%CF%83%CE%B9%CE%BF-%CF%84%CE%B9-1?page=14#image=1|script-title=el:Μετά τον Γέροντα Παστίτσιο, τι;|publisher=MSN News|date=September 27, 2012|language=Greek|trans-title=After Elder Pastitsios, what?|accessdate=October 4, 2012}}</ref>

'''Euphorium''' was a [[Site-specific art|site-specific]] theater installation produced by [[Antenna Theater]] that ran from 2000 to 2002 in [[San Francisco, California]], [[London, England]], and [[Black Rock City, Nevada]].
The piece is based on [[Samuel Taylor Coleridge]]'s poem, [[Kubla Khan]]. It was one of a series of installations Antenna Theater's director, Chris Hardman, describes as "walkmanology", in which audience members are guided through a set wearing headphone devices. For Euphorium, the audience members were given specially-designed helmets that included not only stereo speakers, but also a periscope-like device by which they would view a diorama created on a room's ceiling as they walked slowly through the performance. Infrared triggers would initiate various [[mp3]]-encoded audio segments as they passed.<ref name=sfg/> The result was alternately described as an immersive [[multimedia]] performance,<ref>{{cite journal| publisher=Oxford University Press|title=Editing Environments: The Architecture of Electronic Texts|author=Neil Fraistat|url=http://llc.oxfordjournals.org/cgi/content/full/fqn032v1|date=2008}}</ref> and "[[Gothic aesthetics|gothic]] theater".<ref>{{cite book|page=215|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=p4fnEHOuZ6UC&pg=PA214&dq=euphorium+coleridge|title=The Routledge Companion to Gothic|author=Catherine Spooner, Emma McEvoy|publisher=Routledge|date=2007|isbn=978-0-415-39843-5}}</ref>
Hardman had founded a successful company, [[Antenna Audio]], by applying the innovation to self-guided museum tours, beginning with [[Alcatraz Island]].<ref name=sfg>{{cite news|publisher=San Francisco Chronicle|title=You're Dreaming: A psychedelic journey awaits all who find their way to Antenna Theater's "Euphorium'|author=Robert Hurwitt|date=2001-02-17|url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2001/02/17/DD148057.DTL&hw=KUBLA&sn=003&sc=823}}</ref> The production also made use of a 19th-century optical technique known as "[[Pepper's Ghost]]", and various puppetry techniques, which Hardman learned in the 1970s as a member of [[Bread and Puppet Theater]] at [[Coney Island]].<ref name=sfg/><ref name=hm>{{cite news|publisher=San Francisco Chronicle|title=Hardman does it with smoke, mirrors and a tape player|url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?file=/chronicle/archive/2001/11/09/NB40913.DTL|author=Alex Horvath|date=2001-11-09}}</ref>
The initial production ran from 2000 to 2001 in an old army building in the [[Presidio of San Francisco]]<ref name=sfg/> that also included a mock [[opium den]].<ref name=hm/> In 2002-2003 Antenna partnered with Soho Theatre Company for a run in the cave-like basement of [[The Roundhouse]] in [[Camden Town]], London.<ref>{{cite news|publisher=British Broadcasting Company|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/london/entertainment/theatre/euphorium.shtml|title=The Euphor!um experience:From Xanadu to Camden |author=Mark Shenton}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|publisher=The Independent|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/theatre-dance/features/euphorium-the-stately-pleasuredome-camdenstyle-639683.html|title=Euphorium: The stately pleasure-dome, Camden-style; Coleridge's opium poetry fragment 'Kubla Khan' comes to life in a London undercroft|author=Phil Tinline|date=2002-08-11}}</ref>
==Reception== Critical response was mixed, with some complaining that the show's technology and effects were unrefined.<ref name=sfg/> The production was also criticized as being confusing, and showing a misunderstanding of the meaning of Coleridge's poem.<ref>{{cite news|publisher=Curtain Up|date=2002|author=Brian Glover|url=http://www.curtainup.com/euphorium.html}}</ref>

{{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} {{dictdef}} '''For all practical purposes (FAPP)''' is a [[wikt:pragmatic|pragmatic]] approach towards the problem of incompleteness of every [[science|scientific]] [[theory]] and the usage of [[Limit (mathematics)|asymptotical]] [[approximation]]s.
When a [[physicist]] makes an approximation - which can not be justified on rigorous grounds - he or she may attempt to justify it by saying the results obtained are good for all practical purposes (FAPP). Meaning they agree with our experience and [[approximation error]]s cannot be detected in practical [[measurement]]s (for instance, if the error is smaller than the measurement resolution).
FAPP theories are incomplete or lackly-based theories that nevertheless have very high agreement with experiments and tend to be very useful for all practical purposes.
==See also== * [[Hand waving]] * [[Philosophy of science]] * [[Metaphysics]] * [[Limit (mathematics)]] * [[Phenomenalism]] * [[Empiricism]]
